result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark D Schultz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Muskego Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Attend a Victim Impact Panel meeting.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mark D Schultz in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS 4 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 1 day) (Defendant remanded into custody and sentence to begin forthwith).
  -  2 YEARS 4 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Attend Victim Impact Panel.

DL REVOCATION: 36 MONTHS..

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 MONTHS.

FINE $3,089.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

BLOOD DRAW FEE: $35.00 (to be forward to City of Muskego Police Department).

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Mark D Schultz in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carson requests the warrant be quashed.  The Court quashes the warrant.  The Court addresses the Defendant's non compliance/tamper with the SCRAM bracelet.  The State requests an increase in cash bail.  The Court orders bail remain as set and reminds the Defendant the importance of complying with WCS.  The State files an amended information in Court and the reading is waived and a plea of not guilty is entered.  Attorney Carson waives a preliminary hearing on the 2nd count.  Attorney Carson receives an offer in Court from the State and requests additional time to discuss the offer with this client.   The January 20, 2015 hearing remains as set.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.    Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
